description:
{{nihongo|'''Ayumi Ishida'''|いしだ あゆみ|''Ishida Ayumi''|March 26, 1948 – March 11, 2025}} was a Japanese actress and singer, whose real name was {{nihongo|'''Yoshiko Ishida'''|石田 良子|''Ishida Yoshiko''}}. She was the second among four daughters.{{citation needed|date=August 2013}} She won the award for Best Actress at the 4th [[Yokohama Film Festival]] for ''[[Yajūdeka]]''. She also won the awards for best actress at the 29th [[Blue Ribbon Awards]] and the 11th [[Hochi Film Award]] for ''[[House on Fire (film)|House on Fire]]'' and ''[[Tokei - Adieu l'hiver]]''.

As for her musical career, she was best known for the singles "BLUE LIGHT Yokohama" (which topped the charts in 1968/1969 at #1), "Anata nara Dō Suru (#2), and "Sabaku no You na Tokyo de" (#3).

On March 17, 2025, her agency announced that she had died from [[hypothyroidism]] on March 11. She was 76.
